qas.question: What author paid for the simple bench at Sullivan's Island?
What percentage of those sold as slaves in North America landed at Sullivan's Island?
What stage of the slave trade provided slaves to Charles Town?
What peoples were brought to Charles Town to be slaves?
Which African coast did many slaves that were sold in Charles Town come from?
What author stole the simple bench at Sullivan's Island?
What percentage of those sold as slaves in South America landed at Sullivan's Island?
What stage of the slave trade stole slaves from Charles Town?
What peoples weren't brought to Charles Town to be slaves?
Which African coast did no slaves that were sold in Charles Town come from?

context: <a3_0>Africans<a3_0/> were brought to Charles Town on the <a2_0><b7_0>Middle Passage<b7_0/><a2_0/>, first as "servants", then as slaves. Ethnic groups transported here included especially Wolof, Yoruba, Fulani, Igbo, Malinke, and other people of the <a4_0><b9_0>Windward Coast<b9_0/><a4_0/>. An estimated <a1_0><b6_0>40%<b6_0/><a1_0/> of the total 400,000 <b8_0>Africans<b8_0/> transported and sold as slaves into North America are estimated to have landed at Sullivan's Island, just off the port of Charles Town; it is described as a "hellish Ellis Island of sorts .... Today nothing commemorates that ugly fact but a simple bench, established by the author <a0_0><b5_0>Toni Morrison<b5_0/><a0_0/> using private funds."
